content: So as we think about where your run rate could be next year, is it fair to take that $11 million-ish of a quarterly savings number off of the $290 million run rate that we are at the back half of this year or is it fair to assume that this $290 million run rate is also a little bit elevated just because you're in the middle of the conversion, and so really, the decline in expenses could be greater than just that cost savings number as we get into next year?
